title: Embodied Cognition-Based TUI Learning Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of embodied cognition theory and constructivist learning theory
context.additional_context: Practical-centered course for pre-service/in-service teachers to enhance competency in utilizing TUI (Tangible User Interface) in social studies education

learning_goals: Learners can explain the relationship between TUI's physical manipulability and learning processes based on embodied cognition theory
Learners can create TUI learning activity design documents for social studies subjects according to constructivist principles
Learners can develop smartphone-based TUI prototypes in limited technological environments and apply them to educational contexts
Learners can analyze the impact of TUI design proposals on learning goal achievement through peer evaluation

resources: Low-cost physical manipulation tools (LEGO, cardboard, etc.)
Smartphone-based TUI (Tangible User Interface) design tool
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
